title: Addressing Rotating Queue

embed.description: From the original clone-tastic One For All to the frenetic manatee magic of Ultra Rapid Fire, featured game modes provide unique spins on the classic League formula. Now, more than two years after the debut of our first game mode, we're announcing a rotating queue that'll bring the alternative action on weekends with a suite of familiar game modes and maybe a fresh face or two.

body:
I'll try to keep this short, but I feel there's a key factor everyone is glossing over when they write on the incoming Rotating Queue. (Especially with the hot topic of April Fools on everyone's minds)

There is a game mode ***every weekend***, One For All, Urf. They're all available.
Urf is not the only mode, and I'm lead to believe each game mode is returning once every 2-3 months.

It's a net benefit when you stop thinking about only one game mode at a time-
**And you don't have to wait another entire year to experience those game modes**

It's the worst thing ever when you have family gatherings or events on that force you to miss out on majority (or the entirety) of a fun-mode, and you know you have an entire year before you're going to see it again.

Don't shoot Riot's upcoming changes in the foot before you've actually been able to experience them, lest you find yourself unable to enjoy Rotating Queue for lamenting "the good old days".
